question-text: Choose the correct answer for the following statements. Do not copy the statements.

set1.question-item-text: Plant only is able to manufacture food through the process of ( A. guttation B.photosynthesis C. transpiration D. respiration).
Base pairing leads to DNA being able to replicate and to transfer information to ( A. rRNA B. codon C.tRNA D. mRNA).
The right ventricle pumps blood to the ( A. lungs B. stomach C. liver D. kidneys), which are relatively close to the heart.
The uptake of ( A. substances B. minerals C. water D. soil) can be passive transport such as diffusion and organisms.
Most plant diseases, around ( A. 60 B. 75 C. 80 D. 85) percent are caused by fungal or fungal-like organisms.
Antihypertensives drugs reduce the risk of damage to the kidneys and ( A. ears B. eyes C. mouth D. lungs) from high blood pressure.
The vivipary germination is found in ( A. coconut B. mango C. agave D. castor).
A neuromuscular junction is a synapse between a motor neurone and a ( A. muscle B. nerve C. glial D. neuroglial) cell.
Climate change is a growing threat to ( A. ecosystem diversity B. species diversity C. biodiversity D. genetic diversity).
Forest ecosystems are a ( A. carbon B. oxygen C. hydrogen D. nitrogen) sink and stabilize soils.

set3.question-item-text: Wheat is a grass widely cultivated for its ( A. buds B. flowers C. fruits D. seeds).
Plant only is able to manufacture food through the process of ( A. photosynthesis B. transpiration C. carbon cycle D. water cycle).
Adenine and tyymine are joined by two ( A. carbon B. hydrogen C. nitrogen D. phosphate) bonds.
DNA polymerase replicates the ( A. two B. three C. four D. many) original strands differently.
Veins carry blood back towards the ( A. muscle B. brain C. heart D. lung).
Most cases of ( A. malaria B. typhoid C. Alzheimerâ€™ D. cancer) are caused by Plasmodium.
Example of non-infectious diseases include ( A. cholera B. covid C. diabetes D. tuberculosis).
A plant hormone is an ( A. organic B. inorganic C. nitrogen D. ammonia) compound.
Multipolar neurone found in the ( A. brain B. muscles C. arteries D. veins) and spinal cord.
The diverse habitats are home for a wide range of ( A. kingdom B. domain C. genus D. species).

set4.question-item-text: The most requirement for traditional rice cultivation method is ( A. fertilizer B. pest control C. weed control D. irrigation planning).
One type of antibody made by ( A. rice B. corn C. soybeans D. wheat) can deliver radioisotopes to tumour cells.
Transcription occurs in the ( A. ribosome B. nucleus C. cytoplasm D. chloroplast) of the cell.
The dissolved mineral ions are transported in the ( A. xylem itssue B. phloem tissue C. phloem fibre D. sieve tube).
The very smallest branches of the arterial system, furthest from the heart, are the ( A. arterioles B. aorta C. coronary D. pulmonary).
Smoking also changes the balance of lipoproteins in the ( A. urine B. blood C. bone D. muscle).
Flowering hormone is suggested to be ( A. auxin B. gibberellin C. ethylene D. florigen).
The middle coat of the eyeball is ( A. sclera B. cornea C. choroid D. retina).
Seeds are kept in cold, dark conditions in a ( A. seed store B. seed building C. seed house D. seed bank).
Pangolins are the only ( A. egg laying B. flying C. scaly D. reptilian) mammal on the earth.

set5.question-item-text: The cell is a basic unit structure and ( A. function B. tasking C. loading D. making) of an organism.
The two strands of a ( A. RNA B. sugar C. DNA D. nucleotide) molecule are not identical but are complementary to each other.
In a plant, the dissolved organic compounds are transported in the ( A. exlem B. phloem C. meristem D. cambium) tissue.
Within any organnism, ( A. blood B. exygen C. carbon dioxide D. substances) need to be moved from one place to another.
Plant disease is a ( A. geological B.physiological C. ecological D. physical) process that affects some or all plant functions.
Female Anopheles mosquitoes feed on human blood to obtain the ( A. lipid B. vitamin C. protein D. glucose) they need to develop their eggs.
The ( A. environmental B. functional C. evolutionary D. anatomical) stimuli to which plants respond to abiotic or biotic stress.
The midbrain is located above the ( A. cerebellum B. medulla oblongata C. hypothalamus D. pons) in the brainstem.
Rhododendron is the ( A. rare B. endangered C. endemic D. threaten) plant species in Myanmar.
Wildlife trade can involve the trade of ( A. living or dead B. living C. fossil D. dead) individuals.
